<rss xmlns:atom="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom" version="2.0"><channel><title>www.washingtontimes.com stories: Politics</title><link>http://www.washingtontimes.com/news/politics/?utm_medium=RSS</link><description>www.washingtontimes.com stories: Politics</description><atom:link href="http://www.washingtontimes.com/rss/headlines/news/politics/" rel="self"></atom:link><language>en-us</language><lastBuildDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 02:27:40 -0400</lastBuildDate><item><title>City: Group buys long-vacant old Chicago post office</title><link>http://www.washingtontimes.com/news/2016/may/13/city-group-buys-long-vacant-old-chicago-post-offic/?utm_source=RSS_Feed&utm_medium=RSS</link><description><p>CHICAGO (AP) - The city of Chicago says the massive Old Main Post Office has been bought by an investment group that plans a $500 million redevelopment of the vacant and deteriorating structure.</p> <p>The city said in a news release that plans to buy and redevelop the structure were finalized ...</description><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 02:27:40 -0400</pubDate><guid>http://www.washingtontimes.com/news/2016/may/13/city-group-buys-long-vacant-old-chicago-post-offic/?utm_source=RSS_Feed&utm_medium=RSS</guid></item><item><title>Missouri lawmakers face Friday deadline to pass bills</title><link>http://www.washingtontimes.com/news/2016/may/13/missouri-lawmakers-face-friday-deadline-to-pass-bi/?utm_source=RSS_Feed&utm_medium=RSS</link><description><p>JEFFERSON CITY, Mo. (AP) - Missouri lawmakers were entering their final day of work Friday with fading hopes of passing contentious bills dealing with guns, abortions and taxes and unfinished business in their effort to tighten ethics laws.</p> <p>The Missouri Constitution sets a 6 p.m. Friday deadline for lawmakers to ...</description><dc:creator xmlns:dc="http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/">DAVID A. LIEB</dc:creator><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 02:24:52 -0400</pubDate><guid>http://www.washingtontimes.com/news/2016/may/13/missouri-lawmakers-face-friday-deadline-to-pass-bi/?utm_source=RSS_Feed&utm_medium=RSS</guid></item><item><title>Senator withdraws bill making Delaware a "sanctuary state"</title><link>http://www.washingtontimes.com/news/2016/may/13/senator-withdraws-bill-making-delaware-a-sanctuary/?utm_source=RSS_Feed&utm_medium=RSS</link><description><p>DOVER, Del. (AP) - A Democratic state senator running for Congress has withdrawn legislation that would have made Delaware a "sanctuary state."</p> <p>Sen. Bryan Townsend of Newark withdrew the legislation Thursday amid recent criticism following the arrest of Richard Diaz-Garcia on federal charges of heroin possession and illegal re-entry. Court ...</description><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 01:14:24 -0400</pubDate><guid>http://www.washingtontimes.com/news/2016/may/13/senator-withdraws-bill-making-delaware-a-sanctuary/?utm_source=RSS_Feed&utm_medium=RSS</guid></item><item><title>Donald Trump's agenda a mystery as interviews contradict position papers</title><link>http://www.washingtontimes.com/news/2016/may/12/donald-trumps-agenda-a-mystery-as-interviews-contr/?utm_source=RSS_Feed&utm_medium=RSS</link><description><p>Luckily for congressional Republicans, there's still plenty of time to shape Donald Trump's policies.</p> <p>The presumptive GOP presidential nominee has released a handful of position papers, but other than immigrants and guns, Mr. Trump has left most of his agenda blank, giving others a chance to help him fill in ...</description><dc:creator xmlns:dc="http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/">Stephen Dinan</dc:creator><pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 22:15:08 -0400</pubDate><guid>http://www.washingtontimes.com/news/2016/may/12/donald-trumps-agenda-a-mystery-as-interviews-contr/?utm_source=RSS_Feed&utm_medium=RSS</guid></item><item><title>Hillary Clinton targets 'Obama coalition' for Donald Trump showdown</title><link>http://www.washingtontimes.com/news/2016/may/12/hillary-clinton-targets-obama-coalition-for-donald/?utm_source=RSS_Feed&utm_medium=RSS</link><description><p>Hillary Clinton's prospects in November depend largely on pulling the famed "Obama coalition" back together for her showdown with Republican Donald Trump, and the Clinton campaign in recent days has taken explicit steps to court Hispanics, women, millennials and other key blocs of voters that propelled President Obama to victory ...</description><dc:creator xmlns:dc="http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/">Ben Wolfgang</dc:creator><pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 22:03:08 -0400</pubDate><guid>http://www.washingtontimes.com/news/2016/may/12/hillary-clinton-targets-obama-coalition-for-donald/?utm_source=RSS_Feed&utm_medium=RSS</guid></item><item><title>Donald Trump's former butler investigated for Facebook threats against President Obama</title><link>http://www.washingtontimes.com/news/2016/may/12/donald-trumps-former-butler-investigated-for-faceb/?utm_source=RSS_Feed&utm_medium=RSS</link><description><p>The Secret Service said Thursday that it is investigating Donald Trump's former butler for making Facebook posts that call for President Obama to be killed, including saying he "needs to be hung for treason!"</p> <p>"The U.S. Secret Service is aware of this matter and will conduct the appropriate investigation," said ...</description><dc:creator xmlns:dc="http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/">S.A. Miller</dc:creator><pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 21:26:26 -0400</pubDate><guid>http://www.washingtontimes.com/news/2016/may/12/donald-trumps-former-butler-investigated-for-faceb/?utm_source=RSS_Feed&utm_medium=RSS</guid></item><item><title>Obama administration to tell schools transgender students can use bathroom of choice</title><link>http://www.washingtontimes.com/news/2016/may/12/obama-administration-tell-schools-transgender-stud/?utm_source=RSS_Feed&utm_medium=RSS</link><description><p>The Obama administration will issue a decree Friday telling all the nation's public schools that they must let transgender students use the bathroom of their choice &mdash; or else.</p> <p><a href="http://www.nytimes.com/2016/05/13/us/politics/obama-administration-to-issue-decree-on-transgender-access-to-school-restrooms.html">According to</a> the New York Times, the letter from the Education and Justice Departments will outline what schools must do ...</description><dc:creator xmlns:dc="http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/">Victor Morton</dc:creator><pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 21:12:17 -0400</pubDate><guid>http://www.washingtontimes.com/news/2016/may/12/obama-administration-tell-schools-transgender-stud/?utm_source=RSS_Feed&utm_medium=RSS</guid></item><item><title>Inside the Beltway: 'Congressman X' dishes up vanity, greed, deceit</title><link>http://www.washingtontimes.com/news/2016/may/12/inside-the-beltway-congressman-x-dishes-up-vanity-/?utm_source=RSS_Feed&utm_medium=RSS</link><description><p>Was it inevitable? An anonymous author claiming to be a U.S. lawmaker has weighed in on the state of Capitol Hill &mdash; and it's not good. Here comes "The Confessions of Congressman X: A disturbing and shockingly frank tell-all of vanity, greed and deceit," to be published May 24 by ...</description><dc:creator xmlns:dc="http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/">Jennifer Harper</dc:creator><pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 20:31:09 -0400</pubDate><guid>http://www.washingtontimes.com/news/2016/may/12/inside-the-beltway-congressman-x-dishes-up-vanity-/?utm_source=RSS_Feed&utm_medium=RSS</guid></item><item><title>Opioid epidemic funding a sticking point in House</title><link>http://www.washingtontimes.com/news/2016/may/12/opioid-epidemic-funding-a-sticking-point-in-house/?utm_source=RSS_Feed&utm_medium=RSS</link><description><p>By Friday the House will have passed 18 bills to stake out a bigger federal role in fighting the nationwide opioid epidemic &mdash; but as with so much else in Congress these days, the effort is turning into a spat over money.</p> <p>Republican leaders say the slate of bipartisan bills ...</description><dc:creator xmlns:dc="http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/">Tom Howell Jr.</dc:creator><pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 20:01:10 -0400</pubDate><guid>http://www.washingtontimes.com/news/2016/may/12/opioid-epidemic-funding-a-sticking-point-in-house/?utm_source=RSS_Feed&utm_medium=RSS</guid></item><item><title>FBI director James B. Comey: Black Lives Matter hamstrings law enforcement</title><link>http://www.washingtontimes.com/news/2016/may/12/fbi-director-james-b-comey-black-lives-matter-hams/?utm_source=RSS_Feed&utm_medium=RSS</link><description><p>The rift between President Obama and FBI Director James B. Comey over the impact of the Black Lives Matter movement deepened Thursday, with the White House again disputing Mr. Comey's assertion that it's the cause of spiking crime in major cities.</p> <p>"We just need to make sure that our policy ...</description><dc:creator xmlns:dc="http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/">Dave Boyer</dc:creator><pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 19:59:06 -0400</pubDate><guid>http://www.washingtontimes.com/news/2016/may/12/fbi-director-james-b-comey-black-lives-matter-hams/?utm_source=RSS_Feed&utm_medium=RSS</guid></item><item><title>Homeland Security signals new round of raids for illegals in child, family surge</title><link>http://www.washingtontimes.com/news/2016/may/12/homeland-security-signals-new-round-raids-illegals/?utm_source=RSS_Feed&utm_medium=RSS</link><description><p>Immigration authorities signaled a new series of upcoming roundups of illegal immigrant families that surged across the border in recent years, drawing a fierce rebuke Thursday from advocacy groups who said President Obama could pay a political price among Hispanics.</p> <p>Reuters first reported on documents detailing raids intended to deport ...</description><dc:creator xmlns:dc="http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/">Stephen Dinan</dc:creator><pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 18:53:01 -0400</pubDate><guid>http://www.washingtontimes.com/news/2016/may/12/homeland-security-signals-new-round-raids-illegals/?utm_source=RSS_Feed&utm_medium=RSS</guid></item><item><title>Missouri lawmakers vote to lower traffic ticket fines</title><link>http://www.washingtontimes.com/news/2016/may/12/missouri-lawmakers-vote-to-lower-traffic-ticket-fi/?utm_source=RSS_Feed&utm_medium=RSS</link><description><p>JEFFERSON CITY, Mo. (AP) - The Missouri Legislature voted Thursday to restrict fines from traffic tickets and ordinance violations, reacting to criticism raised after the 2014 protests in Ferguson that some cities abuse those citations to fund their governments.</p> <p>The cap on traffic ticket fines would be lowered from $300 ...</description><dc:creator xmlns:dc="http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/">ADAM ATON</dc:creator><pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 18:50:46 -0400</pubDate><guid>http://www.washingtontimes.com/news/2016/may/12/missouri-lawmakers-vote-to-lower-traffic-ticket-fi/?utm_source=RSS_Feed&utm_medium=RSS</guid></item><item><title>Inspector general financing restored in next year's budget</title><link>http://www.washingtontimes.com/news/2016/may/12/inspector-general-financing-restored-in-next-years/?utm_source=RSS_Feed&utm_medium=RSS</link><description><p>BATON ROUGE, La. (AP) - An effort to eliminate the Louisiana inspector general's office failed to win House support Thursday, amid concerns about scrapping a government watchdog agency in a state with a history of public corruption problems.</p> <p>The inspector general investigates fraud and waste in government.</p> <p>Lawmakers in the ...</description><dc:creator xmlns:dc="http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/">MELINDA DESLATTE</dc:creator><pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 18:44:55 -0400</pubDate><guid>http://www.washingtontimes.com/news/2016/may/12/inspector-general-financing-restored-in-next-years/?utm_source=RSS_Feed&utm_medium=RSS</guid></item><item><title>Muncie mayor says FBI is investigating city's government</title><link>http://www.washingtontimes.com/news/2016/may/12/muncie-mayor-says-fbi-is-investigating-citys-gover/?utm_source=RSS_Feed&utm_medium=RSS</link><description><p>MUNCIE, Ind. (AP) - Muncie Mayor Dennis Tyler says the FBI is investigating the city's government for possible wrongdoing.</p> <p>Tyler told The Star Press (http://tspne.ws/1VUXObO ) that his administration has provided information to investigators and he has advised his department heads to cooperate with the investigation.</p> <p>FBI spokeswoman Wendy Osborne ...</description><pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 18:16:26 -0400</pubDate><guid>http://www.washingtontimes.com/news/2016/may/12/muncie-mayor-says-fbi-is-investigating-citys-gover/?utm_source=RSS_Feed&utm_medium=RSS</guid></item><item><title>Texas court to hear challenge on immigrant detention centers</title><link>http://www.washingtontimes.com/news/2016/may/12/texas-court-to-hear-challenge-on-immigrant-detenti/?utm_source=RSS_Feed&utm_medium=RSS</link><description><p>HOUSTON (AP) - A court hearing Friday over the licensing of immigrant detention centers in Texas is likely to delve into the unresolved question of whether children illegally crossing the southern U. S. border can be held for long periods at facilities that federal officials say are vital to prepare ...</description><dc:creator xmlns:dc="http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/">JUAN A. LOZANO</dc:creator><pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 16:58:02 -0400</pubDate><guid>http://www.washingtontimes.com/news/2016/may/12/texas-court-to-hear-challenge-on-immigrant-detenti/?utm_source=RSS_Feed&utm_medium=RSS</guid></item><item><title>Department of Labor fines Florida farm $1.4 million dollars</title><link>http://www.washingtontimes.com/news/2016/may/12/department-of-labor-fines-florida-farm-14-million-/?utm_source=RSS_Feed&utm_medium=RSS</link><description><p>WIMAUMA, Fla. (AP) - The U.S. Department of Labor says it assessed civil penalties of more than $1.4 million dollars against a Florida vegetable supplier after a two-year federal investigation.</p> <p>According to a news release sent Thursday, Department of Labor investigators found that Red Diamond Farms violated provisions of the ...</description><pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 16:57:11 -0400</pubDate><guid>http://www.washingtontimes.com/news/2016/may/12/department-of-labor-fines-florida-farm-14-million-/?utm_source=RSS_Feed&utm_medium=RSS</guid></item><item><title>Obama administration won't strip federal funds from North Carolina over bathroom law</title><link>http://www.washingtontimes.com/news/2016/may/12/obama-administration-wont-strip-federal-funds-nort/?utm_source=RSS_Feed&utm_medium=RSS</link><description><p>The Obama administration announced on Thursday that it would not attempt to strip federal education funding from North Carolina over a bathroom regulation it says violates federal nondiscrimination law.</p> <p>White House Press Secretary Josh Earnest said an inter-agency evaluation advised against stripping millions of federal education dollars from the state ...</description><dc:creator xmlns:dc="http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/">Bradford Richardson</dc:creator><pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 16:45:53 -0400</pubDate><guid>http://www.washingtontimes.com/news/2016/may/12/obama-administration-wont-strip-federal-funds-nort/?utm_source=RSS_Feed&utm_medium=RSS</guid></item><item><title>Lindsey Graham reports 'cordial, pleasant phone conversation' with Donald Trump</title><link>http://www.washingtontimes.com/news/2016/may/12/graham-cordial-pleasant-phone-conversation-trump/?utm_source=RSS_Feed&utm_medium=RSS</link><description><p>Sen. Lindsey Graham said Thursday he had a "cordial, pleasant phone conversation" with presumptive GOP presidential nominee Donald Trump on Wednesday that touched on national security &mdash; though Mr. Graham still isn't endorsing Mr. Trump's candidacy.</p> <p>"I congratulated him on winning the Republican nomination for president," Mr. Graham said in ...</description><dc:creator xmlns:dc="http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/">David Sherfinski</dc:creator><pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 16:28:00 -0400</pubDate><guid>http://www.washingtontimes.com/news/2016/may/12/graham-cordial-pleasant-phone-conversation-trump/?utm_source=RSS_Feed&utm_medium=RSS</guid></item><item><title>The Latest: California Senate ends fundraising blackout</title><link>http://www.washingtontimes.com/news/2016/may/12/the-latest-california-senate-ends-fundraising-blac/?utm_source=RSS_Feed&utm_medium=RSS</link><description><p>SACRAMENTO, Calif. (AP) - The Latest on the California Senate ending lobbyist fundraising restrictions (all times local):</p> <p>10:55 a.m.</p> <p>The California Senate is backing away from the fundraising blackout it imposed after a series of ethical violations led to the suspension of three senators 2014.</p> <p>Senators voted 24-8 to reverse ...</description><pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 16:05:55 -0400</pubDate><guid>http://www.washingtontimes.com/news/2016/may/12/the-latest-california-senate-ends-fundraising-blac/?utm_source=RSS_Feed&utm_medium=RSS</guid></item><item><title>Larry Hogan, Maryland governor, announces cuts to 155 state fees</title><link>http://www.washingtontimes.com/news/2016/may/12/larry-hogan-maryland-governor-announces-cuts-to-15/?utm_source=RSS_Feed&utm_medium=RSS</link><description><p>Maryland Gov. Larry Hogan on Thursday announced cuts to 155 state fees that are expected to save $60 million in taxpayer funds over the next five years.</p> <p>Among the targeted fees are a $1.50 reduction in E-ZPass prices, an elimination of the $300 application fee for hospice care and a ...</description><dc:creator xmlns:dc="http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/">Faith E. Pinho</dc:creator><pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 15:28:05 -0400</pubDate><guid>http://www.washingtontimes.com/news/2016/may/12/larry-hogan-maryland-governor-announces-cuts-to-15/?utm_source=RSS_Feed&utm_medium=RSS</guid></item></channel></rss>
